result.execSummary:
The defendant Ruoyu Zhang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).
  • False Imprisonment, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MA]Case called at 2:27pm
Defendant Ruoyu  Zhang in court with Attorney Mark Arthur Eisenberg and Attorney Stephen Meyer.  ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Chinese Mandarin Interpreter Liping Zhao appears in courtroom gallery as stand-by interpreter for Mr. Zhang

ADA Hall provides new victim impact statement, it is in both Chinese and English, victim wrote statement in both Chinese and English.

The Court acknowledges review of Defense sentencing memorandum, and both victim impact statements.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall
Sentencing arguments given by Attorney Eisenberg
Statement made by Mr. Zhang

On Count #1: The Court sentences Mr. Zhang to 1 year jail

On Count #2: The Court sentences Mr. Zhang to 75 days jail, consecutive to the sentence in Count #1

The Court gives 328 days credit 

ADA Hall indicates that there is $100 in outstanding subpoena fees
Attorney Eisenberg indicates that the $100 will be paid today

Counsel verify that restitution has already been paid in full. 

The Court orders that Mr. Zhang's passport be released to him. 
recess: 3:35pm

DAY 3 of 3:  
[MK]  case called at 8:36am. 
Defendant Ruoyu  Zhang in court with Attorney Mark A Eisenberg and Attorney Stephen Meyer.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Ying Patchin and Liping Zhao continue under their oath as Chinese-Mandarin interpreters.
Jury enters at 8:37am. 
Officer Michael Sacco- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall 
--State Exhibit #17, #18, #19, #20, #21, #22, #23, #24, #25
--recess 10:11am, reconvene 10:24am
--further direct examination by ADA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney Eisenberg
--Defendant's Exhibit #26, #27, #28, #29, #30
--recess 11:49am,  reconvene 11:58am 
--the Court alerts counsel to a schedule-concern regarding Juror #7 and the Court informs counsel of a comment that Juror #9 made to the Bailiff regarding the case 
--Jury enters at 12:01pm.  
--continuation of cross examination by Attorney Eisenberg 
--redirect examination by ADA Hall 
 recess 12:19pm, reconvene 1:10pm. 
Jury Instruction Conference is held (1:10pm to 1:25pm) 
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling and the status of exhibit admission.  
The Court reviews with Mr. Zhang his right to testify/not to testify.  Mr. Zhang chooses not to testify.  The Court finds that Mr. Zhang is making this decision knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. 
-------------
Jury enters at 1:40pm. 
The State rests at 1:40pm.  
The Court verifies with the Jurors that they did not see or hear anything about the case last night. 

Offer Kelsey Servi- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by Attorney Eisenberg
--examination by ADA Hall 
--follow up examination by Attorney Eisenberg

Holly Chen- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by Attorney Eisenberg
--cross examination by ADA Hall
--redirect examination by Attorney Eisenberg 

Juanluis Villegas- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by Attorney Eisenberg
--Defendant's Exhibit #31, #32
--cross examination by ADA Hall
--redirect examination by Attorney Eisenberg
--recross examination by ADA Hall
--examination by the Court 
Evidence closed at 2:26pm.
Jury exits at 2:26pm.  
The Witness Exclusion Order is terminated. 
recess 2:27pm, reconvene 2:46pm. Jury enters.
---------------
                                                                                          
Closing arguments given by ADA Hall (2:48pm-3:07pm)
Closing arguments given by Attorney Eisenberg (3:08pm-3:498pm)
Rebuttal Closing arguments given by ADA Hall (3:50pm-4:04pm)
The Court instructs the Jury (4:04pm-4:23pm)
Deputy S. Ganser is sworn as the Jury Bailiff.
The alternate jurors are selected through the tumbler system; Jurors #1389 and #1983 are excused from the Jury. 
The Jury retires to deliberate at 4:25pm.
The Court and counsel discuss exhibits.  No exhibits are provided to the Jury for use in deliberations at this time, however the Court and counsel discuss that certain exhibits are to be provided to the Jury if they request them.  
recess 4:29pm 
---------------
reconvene at 7:43pm:  the Jury returns with its Verdicts:
The Court informs counsel that during deliberations the Court received two written requests from the Jury related to exhibits. In response the Court provided to the Jury, through the Bailiff, Exhibits #5, #14, #2 and #2-A, along with an overhead document-projector. 
The Jury enters at 7:45pm.

The Jury finds Mr. Zhang Guilty of Count #1 of the Amended Information: Third Degree Sexual Assault.
The Jury finds Mr. Zhang Guilty of Count #2 of the Amended Information.  False Imprisonment. 
The Court polls the Jury; their responses confirm the written Verdict forms.
The Jury is excused and exits the courtroom at 7:48a. 
The Court receives the Verdicts, finds Mr. Zhang guilty and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
The Court notes that Mr. Zhang has surrendered his Passport and posted Cash Bond.  The Court does not revoke the Bond. 
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling of the Sentencing hearing.  The hearing will be scheduled prior to July 10th.  
recess 7:50pm.

NEXT:  schedule Sentencing Hearing

DAY 1 of 3:  
[MK] case called at 8:58am. 
Defendant Ruoyu  Zhang in court with Attorney Mark A Eisenberg and Attorney Stephen Meyer.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Ying Patchin and Liping Zhao are sworn as Chinese-Mandarin interpreters. [Clerk's inserted note:  The interpreters are seated adjacent to Mr. Zhang making available to him full interpretation, even though it had previously been established that Mr. Zhang only needs standby-role interpretation.  Through the Court's headset-system, Chinese-Mandarin interpretation is also provided to the alleged victim P.Y. during the times she is present in the courtroom, and to those others who are present in the courtroom who wish to have the interpretation.]

The Court addresses procedural matters related to trial: 
--ADA Hall provides the Court with copies of the Witness Lists which counsel have exchanged
--ADA Hall raises a challenge to the Defense Motion-Exhibit F;  the alleged victim P.Y. has indicated that the subject WeChat conversation is not her conversation; there is a lack of authentication.   After hearing arguments from counsel, the Court indicates that it will hear testimony from the witness on this during the trial, outside the presence of the Jury.  
--Service of the Amended Information is admitted; reading is waived; the Defense stands mute. The Court enters "Not Guilty" pleas on the Defendant's behalf. 
--On Motion of ADA Hall, the Court orders Witness Exclusion, directing counsel to meet with their witnesses so that the witnesses understand the Order. Officer Saaco and Holy Chen are excepted from this Order.
--recess 9:13am,  reconvene 9:49am.
--counsel confirm that they have reviewed the completed Juror Questionnaire forms; they have no motions for cause or related requests. 
--recess 9:51am, reconvene 9:57am.  
--Attorney Eisenberg requests that the State's potential witnesses, who were brought into the courtroom gallery for jury slection, be excluded from the courtroom once they are introduced/identified.  The Court grants this request. 
--recess 10:01am., reconvene10:04am. 
--ADA Hall requests that the alleged victim P.Y. be excepted from the Witness Exclusion Order once P.Y. has testified today.  After Attorney Eisenberg agrees to this conditioned upon the State not calling P.Y. in Rebuttal, and after ADA Hall voices objection to this condition, the Court indicates it will address this further during trial. 
At 10:07am the potential jurors in the courtroom.
------------------
Jury Selection:
--oath given to the array of jurors
--Voir dire by the Court: Jurors #723 and #1264 are excused for cause
--Voir dire by ADA Hall
--Voir dire by Attorney Eisenberg
--Individual Voir Dire is held: Jurors #454, #2191 are excused for cause 
Juror selected and sworn: (1) Juror #953, (2) Juror #800, (3) Juror #2138, (4) Juror #1983, (5) Juror #1906, (6) Juror #467, (7) Juror #1389, (8) Juror #78, (9) Juror #1785, (10) Juror #2340, (11) Juror #2032, 
(12) Juror #1807, (13) Juror #1783, (14) Juror #2711
The Court gives Preliminary Instructions to the Jury.
Jury exits at 11:45am.
The Court and counsel discuss the placement of the interpreters in the courtroom. At the request of the Defense the interpreters will now be seated in the courtroom gallery, still providing interpretation through the head-set system but no longer seated next to the Defendant at counsel table.
recess 11:46am,  reconvene 12:00pm Jury enters.
----------------
Opening Statements given by ADA Hall, by Attorney Meyer.
recess 12:40pm., reconvene 1:45pm. Jury enters
 ---------------

Teai Czajka- sworn and testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall 
--cross examination by Attorney Eisenberg
--Defendant's Exhibits #1, #2, #3
--redirect examination by ADA Hall

Martyna Malinowska- sworn and testifies

--State's Exhibit #5

Officer Kelsey Servi- sworn and testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall 
--cross examination by Attorney Meyer
Jury is excused for the day at 4:22pm. 
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling of witnesses. 
recess 4:28pm.

[MK] case called at 1:35pm. 
Defendant Ruoyu  Zhang, Attorney Mark Eisenberg, and Attorney Stephen Meyer appear by telephone.   ADA Monica Hall appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall indicates that she has been working on the redaction of the interview-video, and the parties are disagreeing on the Court's ruling as to lines on Page 88.  
After hearing arguments from counsel, the Court rules that Page 88- lines 3 through 18 are admissible. 
ADA Hall indicates that, based on a prior ruling of the Court, she is striking Page 99- lines 19 through 24. 
recess 1:45pm.

Amended

Court's Further Decision on Portions of the August 25, 2015 Interview

cc: DA and Attorneys Meyer and Eisenberg(electronically) by COC on 5/16/18--ma
Juror Questionnaire-revised

[MK] case called at 11:29am. 
Defendant Ruoyu  Zhang in court with Attorney Mark A Eisenberg and Attorney Stephen Meyer.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Meyer confirms that Mr. Zhang only needs the Court's interpreter to serve in a standby-role. 
Ying Patchin is sworn as Standby Chinese-Mandarin Interpreter for Mr. Zhang.
The Court and counsel discuss the proposed Juror Questionnaire.  The Court indicates that potential jurors are to arrive at 8:30am on the morning of trial commencement to complete the written questionnaires.  
The Court directs that the Jury Clerk is to arrange for a panel of forty jurors to be available in the courtroom for jury selection; there will be 24 jurors in the jury box during the selection process.
---------------
Attorney Eisenberg requests that the Court allow a trial deposition of the Defense witness Y.L., due to Y.L's intent to be on a pre-planned trip during the trial dates.  
After hearing arguments from counsel, the Court concludes that such a trial deposition may be presented under (5)(a)(2).  The Court and counsel discuss that a trial deposition will be taken this Thursday afternoon.  After Attorney Eisenberg indicates that the witness needs Chinese-Mandarin interpretation, the Court orders that the costs for the interpreter will be incurred by the Court.  Ms. Patchin confirms that she is available and will provide interpretation for this deposition.
--------------- 
On the 5/14/18 Defense Motion to Temporarily Remove Case Information from CCAP:
--The Court grants the Motion conditional on the clerk being able to remove access from the Jurors, but not from the general public or the media. If the clerk cannot seal the case from the Jurors without allowing other access, then the Court will not seal the case, but instead the Court will take the usual protective measures of instructing the Jury not to view court records or conduct any research, and the Court intends to ask the Jury members each day whether they have viewed or heard anything about the case outside of the courtroom. 
--Chief Deputy Clerk of Courts Hamre Incha is present in the courtroom. She indicates that she has discussed the available functionality with CCAP staff.  The clerk cannot seal the case to the jurors and still have the case available to the public. 
--The Court indicates it will use the protective measures of instructing and questioining the Jury members. 
--------------
The Court inquires regarding the Interpretation Needs of the Alleged Victim: 
--ADA Hall indicates that it is her understanding that P.Y. will attend the trial each day.  ADA Hall indicates that she has been unable to verify whether P.Y. will not need full interpretation.  ADA Hall is meeting with P.Y. on Friday afternoon and will make the inquiry then. 
--the Court indicates that arrangements will be made so that there are two interpreters here for the trial, so that the interpreters are prepared to provide simulataneous interpretation. This interpretation will be made available to others who need interpretation in the courtroom. 
-------------- 
On the Defense 5/14/18 Motion in Limine re Use of the Term "Victim":
--the Court indicates that counsel may refer to P.Y. as "Ms. Y___" (last name).  ADA Hall is to make efforts to avoid use of the word victim; however if she uses this wording, it is not cause for a mistrial-motion.  
--it is clarified that there is no restriction regarding reference to Mr. Zhang as the Defendant.
--------------
Other PreTrial Matters: 
--Attorney Eisenberg raises that there is still an issue with the recorded interview  between Officer Servi  and P.Y-- the video is 45 minutes in length, however the video cuts out after 20 minutes. He is aware that ADA Hall is making efforts to obtain new copies of the video. 
--Attorney Eisenberg raises a concern related to the WeChat translation; he is aware that Officer Servi arranged for an interpreter to translate the WeChat conversations however he has no information on who translated it. In response, ADA Hall indicates that she has the same extent of information.  The Court indicates to counsel that they should work together to pursue this information with the UW-Whitewater PD. 
--Counsel discuss that ADA Hall will file an Amended Information to designate Count #1 as being the previously lesser included offense charge of Third Degree Sexual Assault 
--In regard to the State's Notice of Expert Testimony and the cellular telephone records that were extracted,  Defense Counsel acknowledge receipt of the phone downloads.  The Defense is awaiting their expert's report; this will be provided to the State.  
--Additional arguments are given by counsel on the admission of certain portions of the 8/25/15 Interview. The Court's decision on Page 36-line 24 through page 37-line 9 is reversed; this will be allowed in.  The Court affirms its ruling on Page 48-lines 11 through 17, and on Page 62-lines 12-18.  As to Page 38- lines 24 and 25 and Page 39-lines 1 through 8; these will be excluded. Page 39-line 9 is allowed. Page 47-lines 22-24 are admissible.  The Court reserves ruling on Page 85-line 4 through Page 88-line 2.  Page 97- lines 9 through 15 are excluded.  Page 98- lines 3 through 12 are admited.  The Court reserves ruling on Page 99-line 4 through Page 102-line 4. Page 104-up to line 16 is excluded. Page 104-line 17 through Page 106-line 18 are excluded subejct to reconsideration as the Court analyzes the other-acts issue. Page108-line 16 through  Page110-line 5 are admitted.  The Court reserves ruling on Page 112-line 21 though Page 119-line 19.   Page 120-lines 2-20 are excluded. 
recess 1:12pm. 


NEXT:  Jury Trial remains on the Court's calendar to commence on 5/21/18, 8:30am.

[MK] case called 9:04am.
Defendant Ruoyu  Zhang in court with Attorney Mark Eisenberg and Stephen Meyer.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Ying Patchin is sworn as Chinese-Mandarin interpreter.
Attorney Eisenberg indicates that Mr. Zhang does understand English, though there are times when he needs interpretation of a term or phrase. The Defense has discussed this and their request is that the Court's interpreter serve as standby interpreter for Mr. Zhang. 
After discussion with the parties, the Court indicates that it will consider the Court's Interpreter to be serving as interpreter for Mr. Zhang in a standby interpreter-role. 
---------------------------
On the Defendant's 12/15/17 Motion to Suppress Mr. Zhang's Statement to Officer Sacco:
--the Court has reviewed the submitted briefing and the transcript of the oral ruling of Judge Koschnick. This Court is in agreement with the findings and the rulings of Judge Koscnick; this Court is not changing that ruling that denied the Motion to Suppress.  
----------------------------
On the Defendant's 12/15/17 Motion to Exclude Portions of Interview:
--arguments given by ADA Hall and by Attorney Eisenberg.  Attorney Eisenberg indicates that he will file a document that shows those portions of the transcript/interview the Defense feels should be excluded and redacted from what is presented to the Jury.  
--the Court intends to view the recorded video of the interview. 
--the Court addresses with counsel whether this is considered to involve discretionary-determinations by the Court
--the Court requires the State to file its brief by March 5th
--the Court requires the Defense to file its brief by March 12th 
------------------------------------
On the Defendant's 12/15/17 Motion in Limine Re: Scope of Testimony of Jin Jin
--the Court and counsel discuss that the State will instruct the witness to answer the question she is asked and not to proceed beyond the question asked 
--the Court finds that testimony regarding the background on how Ms. Jin knows the alleged victim, and what her role is at UW-W is relevant and it provides context 
--the Court references page 11, line 19 of the transcription of Ms. Jin's trial-testimony; the Court will not allow testimony on Chinese culture; the Court will not allow testimony of what the parents were saying to Ms. Jin. The Court will not allow testimony about what the alleged victim was thinking or what her parents were thinking; Ms. Jin cannot testify into the mind of someone else.  
--ADA Hall indicates that she will try to avoid the question that prompts this.
-------------------------------
On the Defendant's 12/15/17 Motion for Cell Phone Records: 
--arguments given by Attorney Meyer, by ADA Hall
--the Court orders the State to make its best efforts to obtain the cell phone of the alleged victim back into the State's possession, if that is still possible. And then the State is to provide the Defense access to this cell phone. 
--as to the cell phone contents that involve communications after the subject time-frame, the Defense proposes that the Court conduct an in-camera review to determine relevance 
------------------------------
On the Defendant's 12/14/17 Motion for Protective Order Re: Impeachment Documents
--Attorney Meyer indicates that the Defense is currently not asking for the Court to take any action on the Motion. If something comes into their possession, the Defense may re-raise the Motion. 
------------------------------
On the State's Oral Motion for the Admission of the Text Exchanges : 
--after hearing arguments the Court requires briefing on the theory by which the next-day text communications as a means of luring Mr. Zhang back to Whitewater are inadmissible/admissible. 
--the Court requires the Defense to file its brief by March 5th
--the Court requires the State to file its brief by March 12th 
-----------------------------
On the State's 12/15/17 Motions in Limine: 
--the Court indicates that Motions #1 through #5 are considered standard-type motions  
--as to Motion #6 - ruling on admiissiliy of the social media posting: after hearing arguments, the Court requires briefing. 
--the Court requires the State to file its brief by March 5th
--the Court requires the Defense to file its brief by March 12th 
-------------------------
Attorney Eisenberg requests that the Court allow for a Juror Questionnaire to be used.  ADA Hall has no objection to this.  
The Court indicates to Attorney Eisenberg that the Defense may submit a proposed Juror Questionnaire for the Court's consideration.   
recess 10:11am.

[MK] case called at 2:54pm. 
Defendant Ruoyu  Zhang in court with Attorneys Mark A Eisenberg and Stephen Meyer and Defense-team interpreter Holly Chen. ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Ying Patchin is sworn as the Court's Chinese-Mandarin Interpreter, providing full interpretation for the alleged victim who is present in the courtroom gallery, and serving in a stand-by interpreter role for Mr. Zhang. 
ADA Hall indicates that she has confered with the Attorney General's Office and they have declined to appeal Judge Koschnick's ruling.  
Counsel indicate that the Defense will be filing motions and that they estimate that three days are needed for trial. 

The Court issues a Scheduling Order: 
--all additional motions, including significant motions in limine, are to be filed by 12/15/17 
--responses to the motions are to be filed by 1/12/18

[MK] case called at 8:47am.
Attorney Stephen Eisenberg appears by telephone for the Defendant.  ADA Monica Hall appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court has made arrangments for this emergency-type hearing after it received a letter from the DOC that Mr. Zhang is not being released due to an issue with the Court's Order vacating the conviction.  
Attorney Eisenberg provides new information that he has been in communication with DOC officials and he can confirm that Mr. Zhang is not being held on this Jefferson County case currently.  Instead Mr. Zhang is being held by Immigration officials in relation to a Visa-expiration issue.  Mr. Zhang is being transported to the Dodge County facility, and he has an Immigration hearing scheduled for tomorrow.  
recess 8:53am.

from DOC requesting an amended order indicating that the Court was vacating the "sentencing"

1) Motion for new trial based on the ineffective assistance of trial counsel is denied
2) The motion for a new trial based on the non disclosure of Brady evidence is granted; and accordingly the Judgment of Conviction entered on 9/21/16 adjuding the defendant Zhangf guilty of 3rd degree sexual assault and false imprisionment is Hereby Vacated

It is further Ordered that the Defendant be released forthwith on conditions as set forth by the court on today's date.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 10:06am. 
Defendant Ruoyu  Zhang in court, in custody, with Attorney Sydne French.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Ying Patchin is sworn as Chinese-Mandarin Interpreter. 
ADA Hall and Attorney French clarify that there is now a realization that the translation that was attached to the Victim Impact Statement is a translation of a separate statement of P.Y.   The translation of the Victim Impact Statement itself is then submitted and added as an attachment to the Victim Impact Statement document. 
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance;  the victim P.Y. is present.
Sentencing arguments are given by counsel.   
The Court reads the Victim Impact Statement aloud. 
The Mother of the Defendant makes a statement in the Chinese language, which is interpreted by the Court's Interpreter. 

On Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Zhang to 8 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 4 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 4 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith.
On Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Zhang to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year.  This sentence is consecutive to Count #1. 
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 The Court gives 23 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo any type of assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--to comply with all Customs and Immigrations laws, rules, and regulations of the United States
--no contact with the victim unless the Defendant has the permission of both the victim and the Agent
--to register and report as a Sex Offender 
--to pay restitution in an amount to be set; the Court will schedule a Restitution Hearing within sixty days
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay all statutory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge

Felony Firearm prohibition/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 11:40am. 

NEXT:  schedule Restitution Hearing within sixty days; the defendant is to appear by videoconferencing for this hearing--Attorney French is to contact the JA to schedule the hearing date
from Attorney French enclosing letters in support of the Defendant
Sentencing hearing on September 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.

State's Exhibit #1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 & 12  (Exhibit #1 Kept in Exhibit Room at COC)
State's Exhibit's #9, 10 & 11 (DVD's)

Count #1

DAY 2 of 2: 
[Court Reporters:  Nancy Weaver from 8:34am to 3:09pm.  Katie Hanson from 3:21pm to end.]
[MK] case called at 8:34am. 
Defendant Ruoyu  Zhang in court with Attorney Sydne French.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Ping Lau and Ying Patchin continue under their oath as Chinese-Mandarin interpreters.  
The Court indicates that the videotaped interview of Mr. Zhang will be interpreted for the victim, even though the parties have stipulated that it does not need to be provided for the Defendant because he is speaking in English.
ADA Hall alerts the Court and the Defense that, because the victim's ability to speak English has become an issue in the trial, the State intends to show a short video of the victim's intial reporting to Officer Sacco. 

Jury enters at 8:40am.
The Court verifies with the members of the Jury that all have followed the Court's instruction to not conduct their own investigation or reseach about the case, nor have they discussed the case with others.
Jin Jin- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
Sarah Chesmore- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney French 
Officer Kelsey Servi- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall 
Jury exits at 9:50am.
The Court verifies with Mr. Zhang that he is understanding and satisfied with the interpretation being provided.  ADA Hall verifies that the victim-witness P.Y. has indicated that she is understanding the interpretation.
Recess 9:51am, reconvene 10:32am. Jury enters.
Officer Michael Sacco- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall 
--State's Exhibits #2, #3, #4, #5,#6,#7,#8
--portions of video, marked as State's Exhibits #9 and #10, are played 
--Jury exits at 11:54am; the Court and counsel discuss scheduling
--recess 11:58am, reconvene 1:02pm. Jury enters.
--continuation of the playing of portions of the video in State's Exhibit #10 
--continuation of direct examination by ADA Hall
--State's Exhibit #12
--portions of video, marked as State Exhibits #11 are played
State rests 2:10pm 
Jury exits at 2:10pm 
Recess 2:10pm, reconvene 2:27pm 
Attorney French and Mr. Zhang indicate that Mr. Zhang will testify. Mr. Zhang indicates that he prefers to testify in English, but with an interpreter on standy-by to interpret if he needs interpretation.  
Jury enters at 2:31pm
Ruoyu Zhang- sworn & testifies (with the interpreter serving in a standby role) 
--direct examination by Attorney French 
--cross examination by ADA Hall
--redirect examination by Attorney French
Defense rests at 3:07pm 
Jury exits at 3:08pm 
The Court confirms with Mr. Zhang that he was satisfied with the standby-interpreter during his testimony.
Recess 3:09pm, reconvene 3:21pm. Jury enters.
State rests 3:22pm.Evidence closed at 3:22pm. 
Jury exits at 3:24pm.
Jury Instruction Conference held (3:26pm to 4:25pm).  During this Jury Instruction conference ADA Hall Motions for the inclusion of a lesser included offense as to Count #1. The Court grants this Motion. 
Recess 4:25pm, reconvene 4:44pm. Jury enters.
Closing argument given by ADA Hall (4:44pm to 5:02pm.)
Closing argument given by Attorney French (5:03pm to 5:10pm)
Rebuttal closing argument given by ADA Hall (5:10pm to 5:15)
The Court instructs the Jury (5:15pm to 5:38pm). 
Deputy M. Kanters is sworn as the Jury Bailiff.
The alternate jurors are selected through the tumbler system; Jurors #1392 and #2246 are excused from the Jury. 
The Jury retires to deliberate at 5:40pm.
On agreement of the parties, Exhibits #2, #3, #4, #5, #6, #7, #8 and #12 are provided to the Jury, through the Bailiff, for use in deliberations.
Reconvene at 7:25pm in response to three written Questions (marked by the clerk as Court's Exhibit B for identification purposes)
After a discussion with counsel, the Court responds to the Jury in written form. 
Recess 7:31pm. 
8:00pm: The Jury returns with its Verdicts.

The Jury finds Mr. Zhang not guilty of Count #1, Second Degree Sexual Assault. The Jury finds Mr. Zhang guilty of the lesser included offense of Third Degree Sexual Assault.
The Jury finds Mr. Zhang guilty of Count #2, False Imprisonment.
The Court polls the Jury; their responses confirm the written Verdict forms.
The Jury is excused and exits at 8:04pm.
IThe Court accepts the Verdicts  of the Jury on each Count.  
On Count #1 the Court finds Mr. Zhang guilty of the lesser included offense of Third Degree Sexual Assault. 
On Count #2 the Court finds Mr. Zhang guilty of felony False Imprisonment. 
The Court orders Judgment of Conviction entered.   
ADA Hall  Motions to revoke Bond.  
After hearing arguments from Attorney French, the Court revokes Bond.  The Defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff; he will be held without bond.  
The Court directs that once the amount for court costs and fees is deducted, the bail funds may be returned to the Surety.  
recess 8:10pm.  

NEXT:  schedule Sentencing Hearing in 2 to 4 weeks (schedule in the second half of September, but avoid the dates of September 13, 15, 19, 22 and 23 due to the interpreter schedule conflicts; avoid the first two weeks of October due to the schedule conflict of Attorney French)--send notices

DAY 1 of 2: 
[MK] case called at 8:48am. 
Defendant Ruoyu  Zhang in court with Attorney Sydne French.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Ping Lau and Ying Patchin are sworn as Chinese-Mandarin interpreters.  

The Court addresses procedural matters related to trial: 
--counsel agree that in the video-recorded statements of the Defendant, Mr. Zhang was interviewed in English with the exception that he spoke two words in Chinese which were already interpreted on the video--the words were used to be sure nothing got lost in translation-- the State and Defense therefore agree that the video does not need to be interpreted.  
--on Motion of ADA Hall the Court orders witness exclusion;  the Court grants the State's Motion to except the Exclusion Order so that Officer Sacco may be present throughout the trial as the State's Court Officer; the alleged victim P.Y. may be present at the trial after she has testified; Officer Servi may observe the testimony of Officer Sacco for training purposes.
--counsel have agreed that there will be audio-muting and fast-forwarding used during portions of the videotaped interview when the Defendant's passport and immigration status are discussed; at that point, the Court will instruct that this editing is occuring for legal purposes 
--ADA Hall alerts the Court and the Defense that the State may be requesting to include a lesser-offense at the time of the close of evidence and before  jury instructions are addressed.
Recess 8:57am, Reconvene 9:08am with potential jurors in the courtroom.

[MK] case called at 10:49am. 
Defendant Ruoyu Zhang in court with Attorney Sydne French.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Ying Patchin is sworn as Chinese Mandarin language interpreter. 
This case is scheduled for Final Status-Scheduling Conference today and for Jury Trial next week. 
Attorney French indicates that she is requesting trial adjournment.  Attorney French provides information on the bases for her request, related to family circumstances that have resulted in her being unprepared to proceed to trial.  Attorney French indicates that a sixty day adjournment should allow sufficient time for her to make family arrangements and to adequately prepare for trial as defense counsel.  
Attorney French indicates that it is very likely that this case will proceed to trial. 
ADA Hall voices that the State has been prepared to proceed to trial in this case since December and that there is a challenge with the alleged victim's scheduled return to China for the summer months. ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance, noting that this pending case has been extraordinarily stressful for the victim.  ADA Hall indicates that it is anticipated that the alleged victim will be back in the area in the autumn.
The Court grants the adjournment request. The Court gives the bases for its granting the adjournment, and the Court requests that ADA Hall discuss the Court's reasons for granting the adjournment with the alleged victim.  
The Court continues the Bond and its conditions.  
recess 11:01am.

[Judge Koschnick presiding for Branch II Intake]
Defendant Ruoyu Zhang appears in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner (For Bond Purposes ONLY).  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Ying Patchin--Sworn as Chinese Mandarin Interpreter

The Court recites Mr. Zhang's right to counsel.
Upon inquiry of the Court, Mr. Zhang indicates that he plans to have counsel, he is unsure whether it will be privately retained or Public Defender appointed

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court inquires of Mr. Zhang his current address and possession of passport

The Court requires a $5,000 CASH bond, with conditions:
--Mr. Zhang must deposit a VALID Chinese passport with the Jefferson County Clerk of Courts or Jefferson County Jail prior to release
--No Contact with the alleged victim, P.Y., either directly or through a third party, except a lawyer
--not to be present on the University of Wisconsin-Whitewater campus, with the EXCEPTION that Mr. Zhang may return to campus ONE time to retrieve his personal belongings including his cell phone and his automobile, this MUST be in the presence of law enforcement. 
--not to be present at the alleged victims residence, which is currently the Wells West dormitory on the University of Wisconsin- Whitewater campus
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin, while the case is pending

The Defense requests a speedy Preliminary Hearing
